TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1025
TEI.2.document_title: Rawson Alley to Stephen F. Austin, 01-29-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Rawson Alley to Austin, January 29, 1825. Surveying.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1025

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Rawson Alley to Austin, January 29, 1825. Surveying.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"* *p**person_mentioned*Col S F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir I send you the returns of *person_mentioned*Anderson*/person_mentioned*s, *person_mentioned*Petty*/person_mentioned*s and*person_mentioned* Tobar*/person_mentioned*s, *person_mentioned*Pettuse*/person_mentioned*s, *person_mentioned*Duty*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Eadse*/person_mentioned*s, Sitos of Land and *person_mentioned*De Mosses*/person_mentioned* Labor by *person_mentioned*Col Pettus*/person_mentioned* My Provisions gave out which prevented me from going any further *location_mentioned*up the River*/location_mentioned* I intend going *location_mentioned*down the River*/location_mentioned* as Soon as I can go to the *location_mentioned*Cane brake*/location_mentioned* and back, to finish my work below, if you wish any more Land surveyed on the *location_mentioned*West side of the River*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Opposite the Lake*/location_mentioned* than I have orders for let me know by the first opportunity. My *person_mentioned*hands*/person_mentioned* will be at my *location_mentioned*House */location_mentioned*till I return from the *location_mentioned*Cane brake*/location_mentioned* if you should write before I return; I think there will be some very good Leagues below if the[y] Can be Laid about *location_mentioned*four miles on the River*/location_mentioned* as the Timber is very narrow it will not do very well to lay it off in square Leagues; *person_mentioned*John Tobar*/person_mentioned* only wanted one mile Square where he Lives if he wishes it so after seeing the Lines I will take it off his hands and pay the charges in proportion but no more which word I sent to him; *person_mentioned*Whiting*/person_mentioned* wished me to let you know that he wishes to take Land, below in the *location_mentioned*Bay Prairie */location_mentioned**/p* *p**date_mentioned n="01-29-1825">Jany 29th 1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Rawson Alley */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned* Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*N" B the surveying of *person_mentioned*Jesse Burnam*/person_mentioned*s Land comes to seventy four Dollars 89| cents*/p* *p* *person_mentioned*R Alley*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*I gave *person_mentioned*George Dutty*/person_mentioned*s return to him as he said he was going over in a few days*/p*
*/div1*
